title: Minutes of Tainan City Governmentâ€™s 436th, Municipal Administrative Meeting 4/28/2020
content: Mayor’s Remarks:1. We are now entering the third phase of disease prevention and the preliminary stage of epidemic restrictions. According to the Central Epidemic Command Center, no domestic cases have been reported for 15 days in a row. However, with the virus still affecting numerous countries around the world, we should continue to take rigorous and careful actions.2. With the coming of the Labor Day weekend, citizens might have concerns over restrictions to certain public places or the details of the applied preventive measures. Concerned bureaus should increase efforts in the promotion of relevant guidelines so that people have certain rules to follow. This will prevent public panic and help citizens stay on high alert. Guidelines may include: wear face masks or keep a one-meter social distance outdoor; avoid eating with strangers and choose takeout if possible in night markets or traditional markets; when dine in, distance between tables should be maintained. Currently, crowd control has been implemented in crowded public places. I hope that through promoting the above-mentioned guidelines, people can still enjoy normal life. In the meanwhile, I ask all colleagues to stay diligent and do your best in disease-prevention work.Announcements1. The Labor Affairs Bureau’s report on measures supporting labors. (refer to written sources for details)Decision: Approved for reference filingMayor’s Remarks:The Minister of Labor’s program of “part-time job platform amid COVID-19 crisis” offers a total of 1,155 job opportunities, and currently is still open to application. The program should be subject to a rolling review mechanism, and the right talents should be identified for the right positions.2.
